scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: These letters of Joseph Hergesheimer to Mr. Jones of the Washington, D.C., bookselling firm of W. H. Loudermilk & Co. discuss books from Hergesheimer's personal library that the firm is selling for him.

did.unittitle: Letter from Joseph Hergesheimer to Mr. Jones, of the bookselling firm of W.H. Loudermilk & Co., in Washington, D.C. 1945 Mar 23

scopecontent.p: Informs Jones of the five parcels of books he has sent to the firm to sell or trade since he has no room for anything other than a reference library at his present residence.

did.unittitle: Letter from Joseph Hergesheimer, Stone Harbor, New Jersey, to Mr. Jones 1948 Dec 11

scopecontent.p: alerts Jones that he is sending ten cartons of books and to be alert for strays; and promises to send a small collection of fine arts books when he has finished with the subject in his present work, probably about February.

did.unittitle: Letter from [Joseph Hergesheimer], Stone Harbor, New Jersey to W.H. Loudermilk & Co., Washington, D.C. 1951 May 24
did.physdesc: Envelope. No letter present, envelope only

did.unittitle: Letter from Joseph Hergesheimer, Stone Harbor, New Jersey, to Mr. Jones 1952 Oct 8

scopecontent.p: Sends fifty-two current but hard-to-come-by books to be sold by Jones, some imprinted, mentioning a small edition of Lesbia Brandonby Algernon Charles Swinburne of possible interest for Swinburne collectors, and promising to be along now that the Cosmos Club's renovation is complete.

did.unittitle: Letter from Joseph Hergesheimer, Stone Harbor, New Jersey, to Mr. Jones, Washington, D.C. 1954 Apr 6

scopecontent.p: Sends along forty-seven books in good condition to be sold for him.
